intro: Cardiostegia kotschyi, commonly known as the mountain bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Eastern Mediterranean. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
